mdRecord.dcterms:title: Visitors and Members of the American Legion Celebrate Washington's Birthday, February 22, 1948
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Black and white photographic print of visitors and members of The American Legion Celebrate Washington's Birthday on the piazza and a snow covered east lawn. A typed caption on the reverse reads: (American Legion News Service) - The snow-banked memorial of Mount Vernon was the site of The American Legion's observance of the 216th birthday of George Washington. Shown above is a gathering of Legionnaires and friends who braved the elements to witness the tribute highlighted by an address by Attorney General Tom C. Clark (center of porch) over a nationwide radio hookup. Flanking the Attorney General is the Legion's National Guard of Honor.
